intro: Hovea latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf hovea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with broad, lance-shaped leaflets and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. Hovea latifolia is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its ecological significance includes providing habitat and food for various native fauna.
